abstract: General Electric intends to buy back $3 billion of preferred stock from Warren E. Buffett, an indication of the company’s financial rebound.
snippet: General Electric intends to buy back $3 billion of preferred stock from Warren E. Buffett, an indication of the company’s financial rebound.
lead_paragraph: When Warren E. Buffett invests in companies like General Electric or Goldman Sachs, markets almost always interpret it as a great vote of confidence. But is it not an even more positive signal when those same companies, returned to health and flush with abundant profits, pay him back? If so, then investors might want to use G.E.’s decision to return Mr. Buffett’s money — which served as a life raft to the company during the 2008 crisis — to reflect on just how much better off the American financial system has become.

byline.original: By ROB COX, AGNEST T. CRANE and HUGO DIXON
